answers.answer: Lots of water.  I am due the same day and am not yet having issues but I'm also at home right now and changing my position regularly to prevent edema.  Oh....I just had a thought.  You should check in with your doc to check your blood pressure.  Preeclampsia could cause early swelling and should be dealt with accordingly as soon as possible (if it is high).

Thanks for the help I did end up calling my doctor he wanted me to go on bed rest he didn't say how long though ? my blood pressure was kinda high when I got it checked maybe just bc my nerves. I go back Thursday for my monthly appointment to find out the gender. I wonder if I should just quit my job or tough it out I planned on staying home with the baby anyways... This is my first and I just keep hoping and praying everything will be ok !
I would talk it over with your doctor.  I am sure everything will be fine.  Just take care of yourself...get lots of rest...try to avoid stress.

question: I'm 16 weeks and 4 days due date Dec 14th has anyone else had ankle and feet swelling yet? I'm on my feet 6 to 9 hours everydday at work they swell so bad that my sock and shoe start to cut the circulation off to my foot! Help what can I do not only is it annoying its painful....
title: swelling at 16 weeks
